articles.author: Luke Plunkett
articles.description:
Gran Turismo is a video game series entirely devoid of character. That’s not a criticism, just a fact: it wants to be a glossy car brochure, not tell a story, and it’s an approach that has served the games well over the decades. Now that Hollywood is making a Gran Turismo movie, though, that could have been a problem.

Read more...
articles.title: The Gran Turismo Movie Actually Has A Plot

articles.author: Eric Schulkin
articles.description: Read more...
articles.title: Hollow Knight: Silksong’s New Gameplay Trailer Is Living Rent-Free In Our Brains

articles.author: Luke Plunkett
articles.description:
In 2015 mega-publisher Electronic Soft released the blockbuster game BloodDeath: DeathBlood, a sequel to 2009's wildly successful BloodDeath. It would mark the end of both the series and its development studio, but it is not the end of their story.
Read more...
articles.title: The Story Of 2022's Biggest Video Game*

articles.author: Zack Zwiezen
articles.description:
In an interview published today, Bethesda’s creative director Todd Howard revealed the studio’s future plans, explaining that after the Elder Scrolls 6 comes out, the studio’s next game will be Fallout 5, the next main entry in the company’s post-apocalyptic open-world RPG franchise. However, considering how long it…
Read more...
articles.title: Fallout 5 Is Bethesda’s Next Game After Elder Scrolls 6, Will Probably Be Out By 2050

articles.author: Zack Zwiezen
articles.description:
Redfall is the next big game from Bethesda and Arkane, makers of immersive sims like Prey and Dishonored. It opened last weekend’s Xbox showcase event. And a lot of the trailers and footage shown so far make it look a lot like Left 4 Dead. Bethesda, it seems, is not pleased about those comparisons and has spent the…
Read more...
articles.title: Bethesda Really Wants Y’all To Know That Redfall Ain’t Left 4 Dead

articles.author: Ari Notis
articles.description:
For their latest trick, the pixel-analyzing masters at Digital Foundry picked a hot-button item: The Last of Us Part I. Though the question at the core of Part I—does this need to exist?—is still very much in play, you can’t deny a glow-up when you see one.
Read more...
articles.title: The Last Of Us Remake Is Extremely Detailed, But Does It Matter?

articles.author: Ethan Gach
articles.description:
Sci-fi horror shooter S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2 won’t arrive in 2022 after all. During Xbox and Bethesda’s extended showcase livestream today, developer GSC Game World shared a new story trailer and confirmed the game was delayed until 2023. It also presented a video developer diary in which staff at the Ukrainian studio…
Read more...
articles.title: S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2 Devs Open Up About Life During The Russian Invasion

articles.author: Ashley Bardhan
articles.description:
Some poor Team Fortress 2 players—beleaguered by bots, stomachs growling from the game’s lack of major updates—wrongly believed they would finally get a dose of good news after spotting the Engineer character in a promotional image for PC Gamer’s PC Gaming Show on June 12. They did not.

Read more...
articles.title: Team Fortress 2 Fans Inconsolable After PC Gaming Show Snub

articles.author: Zack Zwiezen
articles.description:
Although rumors have recently been inescapable that a remaster of Rare’s landmark N64 shooter, GoldenEye 007, is coming soon, as of yet there’s been no official announcement. Thankfully, you don’t have to wait for a remaster of GoldenEye to play that kind of game again. A new Steam shooter, Agent 64: Spies Never Die,…
Read more...
articles.title: New Retro FPS Is The GoldenEye 64 Sequel You Always Wanted

articles.author: Ari Notis
articles.description:
Sony’s big revamp of PS Plus is here. It’s pretty cool. It could also use some work on some of its most-hyped perks, such as game demos and classic hits.

Read more...
articles.title: The PS Plus Revamp Gives You A Ton Of Games, But Is A Bit Of A Mess

articles.author: Jeremy Winslow
articles.description:
So, the Steam Next Fest is currently underway. It’s this week-long digital celebration of upcoming PC games where you can check out tons of demos from FPS role-playing games to casual atmospheric adventures. Developer Altered Orbit Studios’ Doom-like Selaco is one of the available demos and has jokingly received a mod…
Read more...
articles.title: Shooter Dev Makes Joke 'White Blood' Mod After Fans Complain About Blood Effects

articles.author: Sisi Jiang
articles.description:
Diablo Immortal has been setting the internet alight with controversy. Every gaming website under the sun has a take about how the microtransactions ruin the gameplay and how Blizzard was ruining fans’ beloved childhood memories of Diablo. The game currently holds the lowest user score on Metacritic. Still more Diablo…
Read more...
articles.title: What Diablo Immortal Means For The Future Of Gaming

articles.author: Ethan Gach
articles.description:
We’re at a new turning point in Sonic’s 30-year history. The cult favorite gaming mascot is once again a mainstage attraction, besting Sony’s Uncharted at the box office and spawning a new Netflix series. And after making the jump from side-scrolling platformer to 3D soap opera, the series is now going open world in…
Read more...
articles.title: I Played Sonic Frontiers And I Still Don’t Get It

articles.author: Isaiah Colbert
articles.description:
Hope you got a breather from the hours of trailers for upcoming games during last week’s game conferences because Steam Next Fest is now upon us. It’s a week-long event in which Steam users can play demos and watch previews for upcoming games, chat with developers, and give feedback on new titles. The demos will only…
Read more...
articles.title: 15 Next Fest Demos That Will Have You Begging For More

articles.author: Ashley Bardhan
articles.description:
Even years after my last unalloyed school break, as soon as June hits, everything seems to go slower, softer. Daytime stretches into late, mirthful sunsets like it did when I was a kid at camp. But I’ve realized that these hot months no longer mark that idyllic time in childhood when it’s okay to let my guard down.…
Read more...
articles.title: 10 Tips To Survive Your First Journey To The Quarry

articles.author: Luke Plunkett
articles.description:
One Punch Man, originally a manga series and more recently an anime and video game (oh and a very clean pair of shoes), is about to make the jump to another media with the announcement that a live-action movie adaptation is in development at Sony.

Read more...
articles.title: A Live-Action One Punch Man Movie Is In Development

articles.author: Luke Plunkett
articles.description:
Back in March, Elden Ring was the straw that broke my back when it came to PC games not letting players exit quickly and neatly to the desktop. Three months later, it’s lovely to see that FromSoftware have decided to ease our collective suffering.

Read more...
articles.title: Elden Ring Finally Lets PC Players Exit Straight To Desktop

articles.author: Luke Plunkett
articles.description:
After a disastrous launch and months of treading water, the beleaguered Battlefield 2042 had its first major update last week with the introduction of Season One, which saw the game get its first new map, weapon, vehicle and specialist since its release eight months ago.

Read more...
articles.title: Battlefield 2042 Fans Finally Have Something To Smile About

articles.author: Ian Walker
articles.description:
With not-E3 season in full swing, Capcom took the time to highlight its upcoming slate of games and updates during a special broadcast this afternoon. Resident Evil naturally played a big part in the show, which included info on a variety of upcoming downloadable content for Resident Evil Village and some very early…
Read more...
articles.title: Resident Evil Village Will Let You Play As The Big Vampire Lady Herself Later This Year

articles.author: Zack Zwiezen
articles.description:
Do you hear that? Out in the distance, you can hear thousands of angry fanboys continuing to fight online in the endlessly sad console war. The latest battle involves Metal Gear and Death Stranding creator Hideo Kojima and his independent studio deciding to do business with Microsoft and work on an Xbox-exclusive…
Read more...
articles.title: Kojima Studio Confirms 'Good Relationship' With Sony After Xbox News, Angry Fanboy Reactions

articles.author: Ari Notis
articles.description:
Review aggregation sites are hardly the arbiter of a game’s quality, particularly when it comes to user reviews, and particularly in the era of review-bombing. Still, some data points are unignorable: As noted by VGC, Blizzard’s recent Diablo Immortal now holds claim to the lowest user score on Metacritic.

Read more...
articles.title: Diablo Immortal Slammed On Metacritic, Now Holds Lowest User Score Ever

articles.author: Ethan Gach
articles.description:
In years past, this would have been the week for the big annual June Nintendo Direct, but in 2022 the Mario maker is so far nowhere to be seen. But the company could still be planning to close out the month with a showcase of some kind, according to a writer at Sony Santa Monica.

Read more...
articles.title: A Big Nintendo Direct Might Be Coming Soon

articles.author: Ari Notis
articles.description:
A few minutes into The Cub, a forthcoming 2D platformer from Demagog Studios, and it hit me like a train: Everyone wants to make the next Limbo or Inside.

Read more...
articles.title: Everyone Wants To Make The Next Limbo

articles.author: Ian Walker
articles.description:
With Diablo IV back in the news and the largely-maligned Diablo Immortal still a topic of conversation, developer Blizzard wants everyone to know that the two games are alike in name only.

Read more...
articles.title: Diablo IV Won’t Be Anything Like Diablo Immortal, Blizzard Promises

articles.author: Sisi Jiang
articles.description:
Despite public cynicism about musou games, which seem like straightforward hack-and-slash fests against armies of faceless foes amid chaotic battlefields, I’ve long felt that this style of gameplay could bring out Fire Emblem’s best war-simulating potential. Two months ago, I wrote about how Fire Emblem Warriors:…
Read more...
articles.title: Three Hopes Is The Most Exciting Fire Emblem In Years

articles.description:
Available later this week.
Following on from a few limited-time weekend giveaways, The Pokémon Company has now announced another one for Pokémon Sword and Shield. This time around it's a Shiny Clefairy at Level 50, equipped with Eviolite.
According to Serebii.net, it's the same one used in 2021 at the Asia Players Cup, and comes with the move Protect, Helping Hand, Follow Me and Icy Wind. A code for it will be made available between June 18th and June 19th later this week via the official Pokémon Facebook pages. Here's a look:
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: New Limited-Time Pokémon Sword & Shield Shiny Clefairy Distribution Announced

articles.description:
Sample some battles & multiplayer.
Update : This demo is now live - head on over to the Switch eShop to download it. Enjoy!

@monsterhunter - The Monster Hunter Rise: Sunbreak demo is now available to download on Nintendo Switch and Steam! Find it on the Monster Hunter Rise store page on your platform of choice.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Capcom Announces Monster Hunter Rise: Sunbreak Demo, Now Available

articles.description:
“In previous titles, we never really put a high emphasis on combat".
If you've seen the Sonic Frontiers trailers so far, you've probably noticed how the blue blur can now do a lot more attacks.
In a recent interview with IGN, Sonic Frontiers director Morio Kishimoto mentioned how Sonic Team this time implemented a much "more fleshed-out" combat system. Sonic Team supposedly never really "put a high emphasis on combat" in previous titles, according to Kishimoto.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Sonic Movie Was "A Huge Inspiration" For Sonic Frontiers' Combat

articles.description:
Stardew Valley's trial also live in Europe, Australia & Japan.
Update : Following on from last week's news Stardew Valley would be the next Switch Online trial for Europe, Australia and Japan, it's now gone live in North America as well. As usual, you'll need to be a Switch Online subscriber to participate.
This offer will run from now until 27th June and you'll also receive 20% off the full purchase. In addition to this, you can earn 100 Platinum Points by participating in this trial.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: The Next Switch Online Trial For North America Has Been Revealed

articles.description:
Made in collaboration with a child who has spinal muscular atrophy.
Oskar Karlsson and his dad, Andreas, had tried to create the perfect controller before. Oskar, a young Swedish boy and the oldest of his siblings, wanted to play games with them and his dad. But Oskar found it difficult to use a controller because of his spinal muscular atrophy — a condition which causes extreme weakness and wasting of his muscles.
"I like playing games because you can do anything," said Oskar. His dad elaborated: "In the physical world, his body tells him what he can and cannot do, but in the game world there are no limits."
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: This New 8BitDo Controller Was Designed By And For Children With Limited Mobility

articles.description:
Coming to Switch very soon.
You know that thing where you're throwing a party for nerds, and at some point the idea of playing a game comes up, and no one wants to play anything too intense like Mario Kart, so the solution is almost always Jackbox games? But then you have to choose which Party Pack is best, or which individual game is best (and which Party Pack it's in), and uuuuggggghhhh? And then everyone leaves the party because you all divide into the Quiplash faction, the Drawful faction, and the "we like trivia" faction?
Anyway, now you won't have to have these schisms any more, because Jackbox has finally created The Jackbox Party Starter Party Pack, which includes three of the all-time faves: Quiplash 3, Trivia Murder Party 2, and Tee K.O.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Play Some Of The Best Jackbox Games With None Of The Filler In 'The Jackbox Party Starter'

articles.description:
It's cool for cats.
Everybody wants to be a cat. Because a cat's the only cat who knows where it's at. Everybody's picking up on that feline beat, because everything else is obsolete.
And in short, that's why we've put together this list of the very finest and felinest of games that you can play on the Nintendo Switch — so you can be a cat. Or own a cat. Or look at cats. Cats!
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Feature: The Best Cat Games On Nintendo Switch

articles.description:
You can also pet the... everything?
The makers of PHOGS!, a chaotically silly dog-wiggling co-op game, have returned to the Switch with Tray Racers, a similarly goofy multiplayer racing game that's all about using trays as snowboards to surf across sand dunes.
Up to 16 players can grab a tray and get going in the online multiplayer mode, with cool tricks and combos to pull off and a character customiser to set yourself apart from the crowd — or you can just attempt to get the best time in the solo mode instead.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Ray Tracing? No, TRAY RACING, In Upcoming Free-To-Play 16-Player Racing Game, 'Tray Racers'

articles.description:
Not long now...
We are so, so close to getting our hands on the fantastic-looking Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Shredder's Revenge. One thing Dotemu and Tribute Games have been focusing on is capturing the essence of the hugely popular old '87 cartoon and the beat 'em ups of the '80s and '90s, and what better way to do that than by diving into the game's audiovisual design.
In the third behind-the-scenes video from Dotemu, we get a little bit of a taste behind the creative process of the game's animators and find out just what inspired the music of Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Shredder's Revenge.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Shredder's Revenge Devs On The Game's Music And Visuals

articles.description:
Out later this year.
Publisher GameMill Entertainment has announced that Little League World Series Baseball 2022 will be making its way to Switch on August 17th.
With suitably bright colours and child-friendly visuals, the game looks to be a fresh alternative on the Nintendo developed sports titles on the Switch, promising extensive customisation options and up to four-player local multiplayer.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Little League World Series Baseball 2022 To Hit A A Home Run On Switch

articles.description:
Farming, Fighting, And Fishbo.
Moonstone Island is one of the games we're most excited about this year, and judging by the response from the other times we've covered it, we're not alone. The game, which combines Minish Cap aesthetics with a deckbuilding spin on a Pokémon-like battle system, plus farming, crafting, and alchemy, feels like it has something for everyone, and it helps that the art is gorgeous, too.
We spoke to the Moonstone Island developers, Supersoft Studios, following on from the announcement during the June 2022 Wholesome Direct that they'll be working with Raw Fury to publish the game. We've also got this lovely new trailer, which shows off some of the combat, fishing, foraging, house decorating, and farming that the game has to offer.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Exclusive: Zelda-Meets-Stardew In 'Moonstone Island', The Game That Has It All

articles.description:
But it's been a quiet month.
May's NPD results have been shared, and the figures reveal that May has been a relatively quiet month for the video game industry.
The industry overall has seen a 19% drop in sales (for hardware, games, and accessories) compared to a year ago, and at $3.7 billion, this is the lowest monthly spending total since February 2020. Year-to-date spending has also seen a 10% drop compared to the same period in 2021, with subscription gaming the only aspect that's seen year-on-year growth.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Nintendo Switch Tops Hardware Sales In May's NPD Results

articles.description:
The stars of River City Girls.
Following last week's brand new trailer for the latest entry in the Kunio-kun series — River City Saga: Three Kingdoms — publisher Arc System Works and developer APLUS Games have announced that Misako and Kyoko from River City Girls will be fully playable!
You'll be able to play as the heroes from River City Girls in Three Kingdoms' 'Battle of Red Cliffs' mode, a ten-stage mode that you can play with up to four people. In this mode, you'll have access to a roster of 24 characters. You'll need to fight your way through enemies, bosses, and trials, alone or with a friend.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Misako And Kyoko Join The Fight In River City Saga: Three Kingdoms

articles.description:
Is anyone surprised?
We've got the full sales data for the month of May in Japan and it was another strong performance for the Nintendo Switch, surprising absolutely no one.
Nintendo Switch Sports took the top spot in terms of game sales, shifting almost 420,000 units after its launch on April 29th. This performance puts the game just behind its 2006 sibling Wii Sports at 553,000 units, which if you recall wasn't bundled with the Wii console in Japan.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Nintendo Switch Dominates The Month Of May In Japan

articles.description:
"The game has been finished for over a year".
Fire Emblem fans are feasting right now. We're just a little under two weeks away from the release of Fire Emblem Warriors: Three Hopes, a Musou game set in the Fire Emblem: Three Houses world. Three Houses itself has been hugely successful for Intelligent Systems on Switch. And Fire Emblem Heroes continues to be extremely popular with fans.
Yet there's more to come for those that love this strategy RPG series. Known Nintendo leaker and Nintendo World Report contributor Emily Rogers has revealed that Intelligent Systems has been working on a new Fire Emblem game for the Switch — and it's a brand new game, not a remake or a rerelease.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Rumour: Nintendo Leaker Shares Details Of A New "Finished" Fire Emblem On Switch

articles.description:
And it's coming in July.
We're in the middle of trailer season, with showcases and presentations aplenty! And in yesterday's Guerrilla Collective showcase, we spotted something that might be one to hide from your kids.
Hell Pie is a brand new 3D platformer from developer Sluggerfly who was behind the "grotesque" Ben and Ed on PC. It's coming to Switch on 21st July and publisher Headup has shared a brand new trailer to celebrate the announcement.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Hell Pie Is A "Bad Taste" 3D Platformer That Revels In The Obscene

articles.description:
Manual pages and story details.
A major discovery has been made on the cancelled Super Nintendo Kirby game, Kid Kirby. This unusual title, which was being developed by DMA Design (who are now Rockstar North — yes, that Rockstar North), the game was meant to use the Super NES Mouse to launch Kirby across the levels, but slow development and poor sales of the mouse caused the project to be cancelled.
Given the scarcity of information on the game, @KidKirbyArchive has been set up by @Meeper12346 (who formerly ran @FactsKirby) to document as much as possible on Kid Kirby. And in creating this account, brand new information, including manual scans and some story details, has been discovered.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Brand New Details On The Cancelled SNES Kirby Game Have Been Discovered

articles.description:
Update: Will a Switch version happen?
Update  We originally said "keep calm", didn't we? Well, it looks like Square Enix's trademark for Tactics Ogre: Reborn was done for a reason — it's a real game.
Tactics Ogre: Reborn leaked on the PlayStation store overnight, but has since been removed, but not before eager fans could get hold of the stunning new key art and the icon.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Tactics Ogre: Reborn Leaks, But Only On PlayStation For Now

articles.description:
Everything we knew was wrong.
It's generally accepted these days that Nintendo was the first major company to introduce region locking to its products, limiting their use outside specific regions or territories. Heck, if you simply Google 'region locking' and take a peek at the Wikipedia entry, it says the following:

"Nintendo was the first console maker to introduce regional locks to its consoles, and used them for every one of its consoles except the Nintendo Switch, while mostly eschewing them for its handheld products."
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Random: Nintendo Wasn't The First To Introduce Region Locking, After All

articles.description:
Don't get your hopes up, though.
Ubisoft has announced that it will be broadcasting a special Assassin's Creed 15th Anniversary Celebration Livestream, complete with a look back on the franchise's history along with a few teases as to what's to come later in the year.
The livestream will kick off at 9am PT / 5pm BST / 6pm CEST. As for what it'll actually contain, we'd honestly be surprised if there's anything Switch related; Ubisoft is likely to focus primarily on Assassin's Creed Valhalla and its newly released Discovery Tour accompaniment. We're also expecting to see information on new comics, books, and other media, and possibly a glimpse at the much-discussed Assassin's Creed Infinity.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Assassin's Creed 15th Anniversary Livestream Broadcasting Later Today

articles.description:
All I Want.
If you spent the turn of the century speeding around the streets of Crazy Taxi, bopping your head to those Bad Religion and The Offspring tunes as you raced against the clock, you might want to take a look at this new collection of merch that's currently up for pre-order from Sega.
Giving fans of the classic series a chance to show off their love for all things yellow and flamey, the company has listed a small range of products on its official UK store. It's all very much on brand, which should be perfect for anyone who sunk hours into the original on their GameCube or Sega Dreamcast, or anyone who's just patiently waiting for the rumoured series reboot to appear.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Sega Reveals Crazy Taxi Merch Collection, Pre-Orders Now Open (UK)

articles.description:
Update: Original claim definitively refuted.
Update #3: Capcom has finally provided a response to the bizarre saga surrounding the character of Fei Long.
In speaking with Eurogamer at the Summer Game Fest, Takayuki Nakayama - the director of the upcoming Street Fighter 6 - had the following to say regarding Fei Long's potential return to the series:
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: "Definitely No Legal Issues" Regarding Fei Long Appearing In Future Street Fighters, Says Capcom

articles.description:
And because Nintendo wanted them.
We can't really think of Pokémon without thinking about playing with our friends. Whether it's battling, trading, or exploring secret bases, playing and sharing experiences with others feels like a vital aspect of the series. Yet one of these features was almost not included in the original Pokémon Red & Blue.
Multiplayer battles have become pretty much their own thing nowadays, with competitions worldwide and the availability of WiFi and online battling, but Game Freak almost didn't program it into the game. Pokémon Red & Blue (or Red & Green in Japan) was a step away from the action games that Game Freak was used to making.
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Multiplayer Battles Were Included Pokémon Red & Blue At The Last Minute

articles.description:
For the Direct that's definitely happening, we said so.
A Nintendo Direct is presumably right around the corner (latest intel suggests it may be happening on June 29th) and everyone and their nan are currently bashing out a few predictions for what might be shown. With that in mind, we thought we'd share some, too! The editorial team has already presenting some of their own predictions, which you can check out right here, but now it's the turn of our beloved video team, who met up for real in real life for the first time ever... for real!
Yes that's right: Alex, Zion, and Felix finally got together to break bread, clink glasses, and share a few not-E3 Nintendo Direct predictions. Will we finally see some footage of Metroid Prime 4? What about the much-rumoured re-release of GoldenEye 007? Maybe Hollow Knight: Silksong will finally release? Be sure to check out the video below for all the juicy gossip and keep your eyes wide open for an extremely brief cameo from a few friends and colleagues!
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: Video: We Make Some Wild Not-E3 Nintendo Direct Predictions

articles.description:
It's looking positively gorgeous!
In the run up to Live A Live's launch on July 22nd, Square-Enix has released two short trailers for the game showcasing the Present Day and Distant Future time periods.
It's a neat new look at just how distinct the various scenarios will be to one another. Of course, the game itself will feature far more time periods, including Prehistory and Imperial China (which, in case you missed it, we also covered right here).
Read the full article on nintendolife.com
articles.title: New Live A Live Trailers Showcase Present Day And Distant Future Settings
